title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Simple patient care oriented questions. Be ready to put on your empathetic nurse hat, the nurse who acknowledges patient frustration and so on. Just fill you answers with those key words like patient-centered, holistic, healthcare team and blah blah blah
Interview Questions: How would you address a client who is upset?

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health (Bryn Mawr, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and efficient. I first did a series of video recordings and then shortly after made an appointment to speak with a recruiter who helped set up an online interview with the units I was interested in.
Interview Questions: They asked what was one time where I spoke up during a difficult situation as well as a time I used evidence based practice

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Paoli, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview just trying to gauge your personality with some questions about what you know about the lab, but not many. Lasted about an hour and got a call back the next day
Interview Questions: When was a time that you made a mistake and how did you correct it?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Media, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Simple easy situation questions, if you’re not experienced dont worry, they ask a lot of situation oriented questions. The interview itsself was super fast and they reached out fast. The interviewer was nice
Interview Questions: Best way to keep information confidential

title: Graduate Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health (Media, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and contacted by recruiter to go over details about position and what the program is. Very generic questions. Interviewed with the nurse manager of the floor and she went over a list of interview questions.
Interview Questions: What is your five year plan?

title: Sourcer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Had about 3 rounds of interviews. Very quick, easy and to the point. The team was amazing and you could tell the culture is people centered and people really enjoy working here. I had to decline due to the salary not being within my desired range. But lovely people!!
Interview Questions: Why Main Line Health? Why sourcing?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: 1. Resume and cover letter. They asked for clinical narrative writing. 2. Video interview 3. HR interview and discuss which units I am interested in. 4. Virtual interview with the unit manager and clinical educators.
Interview Questions: Where you do expect yourself in 5 years

title: HIM Data Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy but not intimidating. Assessment required. Multiple meetings. Onboarding requirements. Lengthy orientation. Drug Testing and criminal background checks. Nice people. I would recommend Main Line Health to anyone. Good company.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Bryn Mawr, PA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied , maybe a week later I had a zoom interview. They I was called in a week later to interview with the hiring manager. After about 3 weeks I got the notification that another candidate was selected . Process was easy and I felt very comfortable
Interview Questions: They were somewhat easy ! My resume was mistaken for someone else’s

title: Home Health Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Philadelphia, PA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Went through two interviews and a shadow day. Overall I enjoyed the process. Gained a lot of info and everyone was pleasant along the way. Ultimately didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Give a time you had an issue with a coworker and how was it resolved

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone screening, then a 5-panel interview, the feedback, and questions were good. I was able to connect with the whole upper management staff in my interview, received a call back maybe a week later and began my onboarding procedure
Interview Questions: What are 3 strengths and 3 weaknesses

title: Part Time Courier Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Malvern, PA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Rec'd email to set up a phone interview. Chose date and time and rec'd information giving phone number to call and code to access . Called 3 minutes before time for interview and entered code. Entry to call acknowledged and music began. At designated time I stated that I had joined the call and music continued without interruption. Every 5 minutes I again gave my name and said that I was on the call. After 64 minutes of listening to the music, I hung up.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Pannel style interview, nurse manager, assistant manager, educator and 1 staff nurse. Asking application style questions, and basic getting to know you questions. You get screened by the recruiter first then a zoom interview/request to shadow.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made a mistake and what you did to fix the mistake and what the outcome was

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Wilmington, DE) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview straight foreward my interview had to be rescheduled but it worked out in the end I was very nervous before it happened but I thought I interviewed well. I really want to work for this company. In my opinion the best health care system overall
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work there?

title: Registered Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Media, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. They reached out to set up an interview after about 2 weeks. It’s now been 2 months since my interview and I never heard back. My application has not been rejected, but I haven’t received an offer either (yet- hopefully I will soon!)
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work at Main Line Health

title: Nurse Extern - Emergency Department Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Online application is the first step of the process. Followed by, if selected, an interview with at least 3 individuals and successful completion of references. The interview lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Prioritization of 4 different patients that enter the ED. Who would you see in order from first to last and why?

title: Nursing Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Lots questions behavioral questions to see overall temperament. About 3 interviews. All over phone and virtual do to covid. Pretty straight forward questions.  Hiring process took over a month in all.
Interview Questions: What are some words your last employer would use to describe you?

title: Nurse Extern II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Bryn Mawr, PA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I waited for four months for an interview offer, and now I’ve been waiting for two weeks for a rejection or an offer email. Nerve-wracking! The interview itself was straightforward.
Interview Questions: Know one weakness and one strength. I didn’t get any scenario questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process was very professional and organized. The interviewer mentioned all key points in a timely manner. Overall, I was impressed with the experience and can not say anything more positive.
Interview Questions:
Why Mainline Health? 
How did you hear about us?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a Phone interview with HR and the second was a virtual interview. The process was pretty procedural and the questions were standard with the interview process that I have experienced so far in my search.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard interview questions like what are your strengths etc.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Simple patient care oriented questions. Be ready to put on your empathetic nurse hat, the nurse who acknowledges patient frustration and so on. Just fill you answers with those key words like patient-centered, holistic, healthcare team and blah blah blah
Interview Questions: How would you address a client who is upset?

title: Physical Therapist Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Upon completion and review of online application, the next step was a phone interview consisting of talent acquisition manager and site managers. Interview was laid back, though professional and welcoming. Panel did a fantastic job of explaining company goals and values, as well as population, procedures, and treatment goals.
Interview Questions: How your current coworkers would describe you.

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Phila, PA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was approached by their HR Manager. Had a brief conversation with them to discuss the role and gauge my interest in the position. After this a more formal interview took place with members of the accounting team.
Interview Questions: Was asked about any experience accounting with with accruals and prepaids.

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was very easy and smooth.
Highmy experienced in customer service. Achieved friendliness to ensure customer satisfaction. Use of numerous skills to train and lead others. Good work ethic.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself and what role are you looking to work

title: Externship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied and within a week I was selected for an interview. The interviews are currently conducted through video call. I was able to select a day/time and was given instructions. The interview lasted 30 minutes
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you made a mistake at clinical, what did you do to amend it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was average. I applied and after a few days received an email to schedule time to talk to a recruiter. After that interviews with a panel. All done virtually.
Interview Questions: Why Main Line Health and this position.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: My interviewer was very pleasant and made the process extremely comfortable. The entire interview felt more like a conversation, which I really appreciated. Overall, a really great experience, especially as a new grad.
Interview Questions: She asked me about my clinical experience in terms of types of patients I've treated, familiarity/comfort with certain diagnoses, etc.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Radnor, PA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: recruiter reached out via linked in showing an interest with my work history, phone interview with recruiter, phone interview with hiring manager, in person interview with hiring managers team. After the last round of interviews with the hiring managers team I was not contacted and my email a week later asking for an update on my status was ignored.
Interview Questions: Was I vaccinated for COVID19?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Great interview questions easily can be prepared for except for scenarios which were a little harder, but if you can think fast you’ll be fine. The managers that interviewed kept it calm and comfortable
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions:
Very straightforward interview. Was contacted by a recruiter and asked general questions about myself and previous work experience, future goals, etc. 

I met with the manager on the unit after who asked similar questions that were behavioral based scenarios.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you have handled an angry patient in the past

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Questionable integrity from this group. Stay away...I was told I was the candidate for the position and then I was told I wasn't. It was extremely shady and traumatic. I made several important decisions based on accepting an offer, and then they said, "oh, no, we didn't extend an offer. We are looking at another candidate." Very shady.
Interview Questions: What would you do as a first project

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple and easy. The questions were straight forward. The manager wanted the interviewee to feel comfortable. It was easy to get around the hospital and everyone was willing to help.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working with people who have different opinions from you?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: You apply online and rank your top 3 floor choices and rank your preferred hospitals. If selected, you then have an interview with one floor and a manager or two from that specific floor.
Interview Questions: What is your 5 year plan

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty lengthy, but asked good questions. I was really nervous interviewing. I liked how they held a informational meeting prior to scheduling your interview. it was very helpful
Interview Questions: they gave you scenarios and asked what you would do in that situation.

title: Tech Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was smooth. Recruiter stayed in touch throughout the process. Ultimately it was not a good time to start a new role due to personal reasons. I would look into the company again when the timing is better!
Interview Questions: Questions about how my experience related to the role. Questions were job specific.

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied, received preliminary call with HR, moved on to call with department heads. HR  was very helpful and friendly and provided benefits details early on.  After accepting the position, blood testing had to be performed within approx 2-3 weeks from start date. There were only 2 specific start dates with orientations each month.
Interview Questions: Why MLH? Why leaving last job?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: The process was very quick. Asked a couple of questions, more so like a general conversation. I was not nervous at all the whole process was fairly easy. You would love to work here
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself with this company?

title: Several Different Positions Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I applied in November 2020
However the recruiter told me about another position during our interview. The recruiter never got back in a timely fashion. When she did (after I contacted her again) she told me about another position. I am on (3) I did get a interview with the hiring manager. I’m not sure if I was or will be offered anything (no one has reach out to me). 
I know someone that works in the billing department. And they stated they never received the proper training. The DEPT is so mix up and disorganized it’s ridiculous. I’m inclined to believing this because of what I went through in the interview process. If I did not get the position great but at the very least organization an communication is paramount! I feel like I dodged a bullet.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Bryn Mawr, PA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
My experience: Pretty long progress, took about a month to get an interview. The interview was virtual with a department manager,  some staff,  and a nursing student (I didn’t want this thought it was pretty rude and inconsiderate to the person interviewing) They asked mostly situational questions with little interest or regard getting to know me as person. At the end of the interview I was told “you should here back from HR or if they don’t reach out contact them...”  It’s a lot of work completing the application and they also make you add 4 references prior to the interview, a lot of work is done on our end for this process so I think the least they can do is act engaged and interested in the actual interview which was not my experience. 

My stats: just for people interested in applying or thinking about it. I had a 3.9 GPA, multiple past healthcare experiences and references. I truly don’t even think they gave me the time of day. I also wasn’t given any of my three choices that I requested on my application (they do say this happens and that they try there best to match you) 

My opinion overall: it was a pretty bad first ever nurse interview experience for my self it’s not that they were rude it was just blahhhhhh. I felt like they didn’t really want to interview me or even hire a new nurse for that matter. I also wish they asked me more about my experiences than generic robotic situational questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Nutritional Host Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Bryn Mawr, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Short interview with 2 managers that covered basic interview questions that allowed the managers to get an idea of who you are as a person and if you are fit for the position.
Interview Questions: transportation, and getting to work

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process and flexible schedule. Easy to navigate, easy to schedule and good turn around. Very flexible schedule , very very very friendly people and very nice. It is going to be a a pleasure
Interview Questions: What’s is your goal and motivation?

title: Student Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Video interview first then panel interview.  Manager wasnt prepared, and didnt seem like they wanted to be bothered with the process. He kept reading questions off of a piece of paper.
Interview Questions: Ghey gave me patient scenarios and I had to prioritize them.

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview; tour of unit then panel interview with nurse managers, staff nurses and clinical educators. Very pleasant process - nurses kind of just fired questions toward me about my experiences in school, clinical, and previous employment.
Interview Questions:
Describe a situation in which you demonstrated ____?
Describe your "Aha" moment in clinical

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: they asked many basic nursing interview questions such as why nursing, leadership and discussing clinical experiences, 2 nice people interviewing, they probably asked around 10 questions, was about a 30 minute interview,
Interview Questions: Strengths/weaknesses, challenging clinical situation, working as a team

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, asked situational questions, questions about strengths, weaknesses, what would you do? The interviewer was nice and let you think each question. It was one interview with the department manager.
Interview Questions: Strengths, scenarios, weaknesses, describe a time when, policy

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Wynnewood, PA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied in January, heard back about interview offer in February, all GN's were only offered 1 interview with 1 unit, went to an information session in February, interviewed in beginning of March, received an offer a week later.
Interview Questions: A time I have delegated to others.

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview due to COVID-19. Basic interview questions about customer service, schooling, and the reason for wanting to be a nurse. Two nursing test styled questions were thrown in at the end as well.
Interview Questions: Prioritize which patient you would see first.

title: Lab Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. It took 3 days to hear from a recruiter. Recruiter did screening and forwarded my resume to the hiring manager. Interviewed in less than a week. I received verbal offer letter 3 weeks after I interviewed. Stay in touch with the recruiter.
Interview Questions: Six sigma lean questions, how to manage staffing issues

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Applications are only accepted two times per year.  After my application was submitted I heard back within two weeks about the interviewing process and an informational session.  The interview was with a group on the unit I was selected for and took a little over an hour.
Interview Questions: How do you handle people with personalities that may be different from your own?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: always get rejected, can not get past the HR person after applying online. I went to job fair no job, next time I was told I would get a call back from hiring manager never called. I would like to know why I can not get a job at this place. I will never give up. I had an interview once after getting three references vis survey and no offer,  I will never do that again.
Interview Questions: How would I handle a difficult doctor?

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted an application to be a nurse resident in the March 1 - March 14 window that was provided online.  About a week later, I received an invitation via email to an information session and interview. I had to respond to the email saying I would go to one of the three information sessions within 24 hours. At the information session it had a list of applicants' names and what MLH hospital and unit they'd be interviewing for. I scheduled an interview at the info session, and I got a choice of an interview date within a two week time frame. Before the interview, I was sent a link to put in 4 references, which could be completed "before or after the interview" (it pretty vague, but I entered the reference info before my interview.) I also needed to have two letters of recommendation submitted since I was selected for an interview. (There was contradicting information on the website and what was said at the info session about who exactly could write the LOR, and what email to send the LOR. There also wasn't any hard deadline given for the recommendations. When I asked these questions via email I got no response.)

I came in for an interview in early April. Before the interview, I believe it was an HR rep who sent an email with details of how to get to the hospital, the position in general, and the name of the manager I'd interview with.  I also had to email this person my CPR card and fill out background check info before the interview day. On the day of the interview, the manager at the hospital I applied for met me in the lobby and took me to her office for the interview. I did not receive her contact information, so unfortunately I could not thank her for the interview via email/message afterwards.  I heard back over a month later that I was denied.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation you had with a difficult family member.

title: Pharmacy Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed with them then received back ground and reference information.. waiting on offer
The process was simple but i don’t know if i am going to get hired for the position. I hope so.
Interview Questions: What are u passionate about

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Bryn Mawr, PA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: You were contacted to do an in person interview. You had to fill out some online onboarding assignments. You would participate in an in-person interview with 2-3 nurses from the unit.
Interview Questions: What is one time you had to go above and beyond at clinical?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Phila, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Took about 4 months from application to offer. Spoke with HR over phone about 1 month after appying. Interview in person 2 weeks later with hiring manager. Followed up 2 weeks after interview with HR, they were waiting on approvals for several weeks. About 6weeks after interview I got my offer.
Interview Questions:
•	Clinical questions:
o	Do these vital numbers alarm you…
o	Patient INR 3, after receiving warfarin for DVT, do you see this patient? What do you have to be cautious of?
o	OT did an evaluation without checking WB prxs. Walked someone who was NWB, do you see them? What is your next step

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: There were three interviews total-- began with panel interview which was intimidating but straight forward, followed by interview with unit managers and ended with staff interview.  The entire process took approx 3 months from application to offer but this included a new grad residency program application
Interview Questions: how has your education prepared you for a job on a busy floor

title: Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Media, PA)
Interview Descriptions: too many people for a position like this, this was so unnecessary considering the type of job that it is. Even bigger companies and positions I have applied for, I never had 7 people sit in on an interview. Some warning would have been nice.
Interview Questions: how you handle difficult situations

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: 30 mins with Nurse manager and nurse educator. You had the opportunity to ask any questions you had about the position after they asked you several questions. Bring multiple copies of your resume for the hiring team to review.
Interview Questions: Discuss a difficult clinical experience you had.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: I had a pleasant phone interview with HR.   That lead to another phone interview with the hiring manager a few days later.  She said it would be four weeks before the process would be completed.  Less than a week later, I get a call from HR only to tell me I was no longer being considered a candidate.  I didn't have healthcare experience.  Advice to HR, send an email if it's a rejections.  Don't waste the person's time trying to get in touch with you.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Paoli, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a position and was contacted 3 months later to schedule an interview with the recruiter and hiring managers.  The interview went very well and background and references checks were also completed.  After numerous emails to the non-responsive recruiter, I finally heard back 4 months later to schedule a 2nd interview. After the 2nd interview and again emails asking for updates from a non-responsive recruiter,  I waited 2 additional months to receive a generic email stating “thanks for interviewing but we selected another candidate…..”   I have worked in a large corporation in the past and with an HR background, I certainly wasn’t expecting that kind of response from an established and well-known organization.  I also know of other individuals who have applied for positions at this organization and had a similar experience.  The lack of professionalism exhibited during this whole process was quite surprising and eye-opening.   What I learned from this experience is there is a lack of empathy and respect during the whole recruitment process and it is obvious that it needs major improvements because it is clearly broken.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Main Line Health?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Exton, PA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: just typed ask the typical interview questions, wanted to know tell me a time when you were in a complex situation.  I don't know what else to tell you, can't remember.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Philadelphia, PA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Contacted and interviewed with a phone interview then was set up for an interview with all the nurse managers on all different units. The managers had a list of questions and at the end I was allowed to ask any questions I had. The whole interview was about an hour.
Interview Questions: Why would you be an asset to the team?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Philadelphia, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It was question and answer with manager and asst manager. I also had to submit a review from my previous three employers. Interview lasted approx. one hour followed by tour of facility
Interview Questions: Where did you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Phila, PA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: HR took long to reach out. You have to be persistent and follow up. The process took approximately 3 months from the time I applied to my first day, so be prepared for that amount of lag time between jobs.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation where you worked with a diverse population.

title: Telecommunications Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Bryn Mawr, PA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online about 2 weeks later received a call from a recruiter for a brief phone interview. The next day I received an email with the face to face interview day and time and I was asked to complete a reference sheet that was never sent to me. I went in for the face to face interview with HR manager and Department Manager and Director. They were really down to earth and welcoming. I'm waiting to hear back with a decision they requested a background check and employment and education verification.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you and a coworker had a conflict? What was the conflict and how did you resolve it?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Newtown Square, PA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It's a panel interview, kind of intimidating, but if you're a people person, you'll be fine. They offer you coffee and tea, and they make you feel right at home.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite and least liked part of your job?

title: Registration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was intense in a good way all the questions the questions I answered they followed with a compliment or comment in a good way.  The interviews last about a half of an hour and they were very open to the questions I had and showed me around as well.
Interview Questions: Why are interested in the position?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Radnor, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Been applying for years. Finally got an email for a phone screen interview. It was brief. I still have another interview which will be face to face with the Director. I'm so nervous.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Radnor, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: They had multiple people that you would talk to. At the open house a recruiter would find out what you are interested in and set you up to interview with one of the rehab managers
Interview Questions: Inter-professional collaboration

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Wynnewood, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions. Interview lasted about 30mins and was pretty easy. I was first make to do a video interview where i answer questions about myself and random scenarios. And I later interviewed with the nurse manager who explain what the position was all about and what is required of me. the process took about 2 months

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: You are called in for an orientation where they go in and schedule you for an interview that is supposed to be based off of your 3 top preference areas. You then learn about Main Line Health and hear from Nurse Educators and others about the different hospitals in their system. I was assigned an interview and not given what type of floor it was. Do not assume it will be something you list. Mine was not and I was not prepared for the floor I interviewed for. MAKE SURE TO ASK. They then make fill out paperwork with background checks and reference checks that all need to be in within 24 hours.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Certified Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Glen Mills, PA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First interview was very pleasant.  Tell me about yourself, a tour of the club.  
Then you are given a script to learn for your second interview.  Made everyone nervous, but the boss is very encouraging going through it.  Puts you at ease.
Interview Questions: Why did you become a personal trainer?

title: Billing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Newtown Sq, PA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called in for the interview. All of the questions were very straightforward and to the point. they didn't ask anything irrelevant just to past the time.
Interview Questions: What could you add to our team?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Wynnewood, PA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter called me in a timely manner after I applied on line for the PSR position and was willing to work with my availability to schedule my interview. The same day as the interview she called me to follow up on my opinion of the position and set up a second interview.
Interview Questions: How would I calm down an upset patient?

title: Staff Nurse RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Bryn Mawr, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with manager and HR and then with staff a few days later.  Offered job within a week.  Excellent experience! It was quick although thorough, and I knew what my training schedule would be soon after my offer. Manager was nice and very professional. The staff were inviting, and also gave me some great information on what ti expect as a new grad. It was a wonderful experience all around.  I have been an RN there for 15 years and will remain there in a per diem position as long as i can.  I would recommend this hospital and network to friends.
Interview Questions: What previous experience do you have?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions:
it was interactive probing reflective interesting and challenging i was nervous but confident
i was eager to share my passion for my profession and to enlighten the interviewer about the challenges and pressures that go along with being a nurse
Interview Questions: if i enjoy being a rn

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Bryn Mawr, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially I was invited to an information session where they scheduled my first interview.  They attempted to interview people in one of the their top three specialty areas of interest and locations.  Almost a month after the initial interview, which was with the Nurse Manager and a Nursing Coordinator, I was emailed again to invite me back to a second interview.  The nurse manager likes to have nurses from the floor conduct this interview, in line with MLH's focus on teamwork.  This interview was at 7:30am with six nurses.  It was scheduled this early to allow day and night shift nurses to come.  I was told they would notify me early the next week, but it's now more than two weeks later and I have never heard back.
Interview Questions: How would you describe the role you usually play on a team and could you give a specific example of a time you had to accomplish something on a team.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Berwyn, PA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR first who went through benefit information and then HR and the hiring manager together.We discussed my background and experience and they had a number of questions for me. I had about 10 minutes at the end for questions to them.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were not very creative such as, how would people who've worked with you describe you, where do you see yourself in 5 years....nothing out of the norm.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Bryn Mawr, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Following a phone screen, three marathon interviews -- one with human resources, hiring manager and outgoing manager; one with every member of the department; one with members of the IT team with whom I would be working. MLH is really big on whether you can fit in, work as part of a team as well as independently, and if you can handle stress and difficult people/situations
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you resolved a situation with a difficult person in the workplace.

title: Patient Resource Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied a million times over the past 3 years (2010-2013) finally in April of 2013 I get a call from the HR Rep at Lankenau. She called and asked if id be interested in an interview for a Patient Resource Rep position. I of course told her yes. She scheduled me to come early the next week.  She sends me an email with all the information. Time, place, who im meeting with and to bring copies of my resume. So for the interview which was like 5 or 6 days from my initial phone call, I am meeting with the Job Recruiter first. I meet with her for about 10 minutes. She doesnt really ask me questions but further explains the position. She then takes me over to another building where I meet the Site Manager of Patient Access and the department Supervisor. My interview was with both of them AND the recuiter. Im asked to explain what customer service means, most challenging patient experience, how do you handle pressure, are you okay with asking for copays? I honestly thought the interview would never end. The interview was in mid April. Maybe April 16. I didnt hear anything back......I hated the job I had at the time so I called and emailed and called some more. I basically stalked them for the job. And I got it. I got a call back and an offer by mid May and started June 10th.
Interview Questions: Tell us what you would do if your coworker wasnt working hard or being lazy.

title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a little difficult to contact the human resources contact for this position but once I did the process was very smooth and efficient. By the time an offer was made (a week after my interview) the background and educational checks were complete.
Interview Questions: There is a small skills test during the interview process.

title: Revenue Cycle Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: HR is extremely slow to move which hinders production, Was told I would hear something within a week. I finally had to contact recruiter to let them know I had another offer. They still took 2 weeks to get back to me.
Interview Questions: Will your children hinder your performance, (which I think is against the law to ask!

title: Medical Library Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions:
It was good interview and got to know the program
It was great people asking questions 
Somewhat good information
The Interview went week and it last a good length of time
I was happy and that I got into a routine 
I learned  a lot in the interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: I know that the interview process has changed since I was hired seven years ago. Interviews may be behavioral, and may include a group interview. There is always a meeting with the HR Recruiter and the Hiring Manager. You may/may not have to return for a second interview. They seem to hire more based on a canidate's resume as opposed to personal interactions. Questions seem to be more rehearsed. You can expect a more corporate feeling.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here and why should I hire you.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Main Line Health
Interview Descriptions: Would not pay a rate higher than $36.00 even for a nurse with 20 years experience. Disgusted, Sorry I moved to PA.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Consultant Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Paoli, PA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Minimal the process was streamlined and quick. Met two irctheee associates and then had a brief lunch followed by a tour of the facilities. Can't say too much more about the process
Interview Questions: How available on weekends

title: COTA/L Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Radnor, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Main Line Health hosted an all day job fair and I went last minute.  I interviewed with different people and was introduced to many people.  Felt part of the team immediately.  Very professional and very kind.  It was a 3 to 4 hour process, but it was worth the time, they hired me on the spot contingent upon all the paperwork being filled out in the future properly.
Interview Questions: There were no tricky, difficulty questions.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Paoli, PA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview reviewing my skills and goals for coming to work for Main Line Health. Brief phone screen to talk about my goals and experience working for My previous position. Quick In person interview after that time.
Interview Questions: My career goals

title: Operating Room Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Wynnewood, PA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: After completeding an internship was interviewed by OR head nurse then waited months to be seen by HR
Interview Questions: Salary was very small to start.

title: Cook II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Main Line Health (Malvern, PA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: two to three interviews, criminal back ground check, drug testing, job reference check, and personal reference check.
Interview Questions: what are my weaknesses
